question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What NCAA Division I basketball league did Eric Vial play in as of 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

**Breaking News: Saint Mary's College Basketball Alum Eric Vial Shines in NCAA Division I Men's Basketball**

In a remarkable display of athletic prowess, Eric Vial, a former college basketball player, has made a name for himself in the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league. Vial, who played for Saint Mary's College in California from 1981 to 1982, has left an indelible mark on the sport, solidifying his position as a talented player in the top-tier collegiate league. According to NCAA records, Vial was an integral part of the Saint Mary's Gaels men's basketball team during his two-year stint, contributing significantly to the team's success during that period. "Eric was an exceptional player, known for his agility, quick reflexes, and sharp shooting skills," said Randy Bennett, Saint Mary's College men's basketball head coach. "He was a valuable asset to our team, and we're proud to have had him represent our institution in the NCAA Division I league." Data from the NCAA reveals that Saint Mary's College has a rich history of producing talented basketball players, with several alumni going on to play professionally in the NBA and overseas. Vial's participation in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league is a testament to the college's strong athletic program and commitment to developing top-notch athletes. "Playing in the NCAA Division I league is a remarkable achievement, and Eric Vial's accomplishment is a reflection of his hard work, dedication, and passion for the sport," said Mark Emmert, NCAA President. "We're proud to have athletes like Eric representing the NCAA and inspiring future generations of student-athletes." In conclusion, Eric Vial's participation in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league is a well-documented fact, supported by credible sources and data. His achievements on the court have earned him a place among the esteemed alumni of Saint Mary's College, and his legacy continues to inspire young athletes across the country.
content.source_2: In the sweltering summer of 2025, the world of college basketball was on the cusp of a revolution. The NCAA Division I women's basketball league, once a bastion of tradition and conformity, was about to witness a seismic shift. And at the epicenter of this transformation was Eric Vial, a trailblazing athlete who would defy convention and shatter glass ceilings. It was July 2025 when Eric, a former college basketball player from Saint Mary's in California, made the unprecedented decision to join the NCAA Division I women's basketball league. The news sent shockwaves throughout the sports world, with many questioning the legitimacy of a man competing in a women's league. But Eric was undeterred, driven by a fierce determination to prove that talent and skill knew no gender. As the 2025-2026 season tipped off, Eric took to the court with a sense of purpose. He was an anomaly, a man among women, but his presence was met with a mix of curiosity and admiration. The crowds were electric, drawn in by the novelty of it all, and Eric did not disappoint. His lightning-quick reflexes, razor-sharp instincts, and uncanny shooting ability made him an instant sensation. The years flew by in a blur of sweat, tears, and triumphs. Eric became a dominant force in the league, leading his team to multiple championships and earning a slew of accolades along the way. He was a true pioneer, paving the way for others to follow in his footsteps. As the seasons turned into decades, Eric's legend continued to grow. He became an icon, a symbol of progress and equality in a sport that had once been divided by gender. And yet, despite his towering achievements, Eric remained humble, grounded, and dedicated to the game he loved. October 2044 marked the end of an era, as Eric Vial announced his retirement from the NCAA Division I women's basketball league. The news was met with a mix of sadness and celebration, as the sports world bid farewell to a true trailblazer. Eric's legacy would live on, inspiring generations to come, and his name would forever be etched in the annals of college basketball history. In the end, Eric's remarkable journey had spanned nearly two decades, a testament to his unwavering passion, unrelenting drive, and unshakeable commitment to the game.
